subject: Productivity
title: Interchangeable Parts
description: A fast breakdown of Interchangeable Parts for builders.

hook.text: Before Eli Whitney, every musket was handmade. If a part broke, the whole weapon was useless.

buildup.text: Whitney proposed making identical parts that could swap between any musket. The US Army was skeptical.

discovery.text: Interchangeable parts made repair easy and manufacturing fast. Assembly became modular.

twist.text: Whitney exaggerated his demo. True interchangeability took decades more. But the concept transformed industry.

climax.text: This principle underlies everything from LEGO bricks to computer components.

punchline.text: Identical parts made infinite products possible.

quiz.question: What was the key innovation of interchangeable parts?
options: Identical parts that could swap between any unit
Custom parts for each individual product
Using only one material for all parts
